meanings.definition: Having or covered with knobs or protuberances.
meanings.sent1: The knobbly surface of the tree bark felt rough to the touch.
meanings.sent2: She picked up the knobbly rock and examined its bumpy texture.
meanings.sent3: The knobbly potato rolled off the table and onto the floor, causing a small commotion.
meanings.sent4: The knobbly branches of the old oak tree reached out like gnarled fingers.
meanings.sent5: The knobbly handle of the door was difficult to grip.

meanings.sent1: He felt a knobbly on the back of his neck and wondered what it could be.
meanings.sent2: The knobbly on the surface of the fruit made it difficult to peel.
meanings.sent3: The knobbly on the tablecloth caused the glass to wobble precariously.
meanings.sent4: The knobbly in the carpet caught her toe, causing her to stumble.
meanings.sent5: The knobbly on the tree trunk looked like a tiny bump.
